meanings.definition: Capable of being defended or justified.
meanings.sent1: The argument lacked defensibility, making it hard to support.
meanings.sent2: She presented a defensibility case that convinced everyone.
meanings.sent3: His defensibility explanation was so weak, it made us laugh.
meanings.sent4: The fortress was built with such defensibility that no enemy could breach it.
meanings.sent5: The defensibility of her position was unquestionable.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to withstand attack or criticism.
meanings.sent1: The defensibility of the shield was tested in battle.
meanings.sent2: His defensibility in the debate impressed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat's defensibility against the dog was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her defensibility in the face of adversity was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The defensibility of the wall was crucial in protecting the city.
